channel.title: tabbed view missions
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "tabbed view missions"

item.title: Re: tabbed view missions
item.content:encoded:
http://bvs.wikidot.com/missionstabbed

The page is done. Now it needs a menu link so that people can view it.
I will try to keep it updated.

item.title: Re: tabbed view missions
item.content:encoded: if we have tabs then we should be given the option to view it that way or "classic"

item.title: Re: tabbed view missions
item.content:encoded:
@Uzuki: Understood. It's good to know your stance on this.

@North: As far as I can tell, it's a bug due to the naming of the elements. As I mentioned before, if you use the "Recent Posts" feature, then mine will work there because it's the highest tabview element on the page now.

(Edit: apparently it generates the code for the tabs seperatately for each (post here in the forums, and possibly other sections used in the main pages) of the page. It might work on the pages, but we shouldn't implement it if Uzuki feels it would impede the purpose of the Wiki, by making the info harder to get to.)

item.title: Re: tabbed view missions
item.content:encoded: I'd prefer no tabs on any of the main pages.

item.title: Re: tabbed view missions
item.content:encoded:
@Jadian this tabs you posted don't work because you missed something in the code. It is not usefull to have a tab with List all and then separated in Gen, Nin, Tai. The page would just load in a longer time because of the duplicate information.

I would like that compression. I find myself scrolling like mad through the page to get to the section I am interested (yes I know I have links above, and geting to them requires alot of scrolling).
Well, I will leave the missions as they are for now.

Just checked out that bug for myself. It may be that you forgot to close your tabview or there is a bug.

item.title: Re: tabbed view missions
item.content:encoded:
I dunno, I think it makes it harder to eyeball the specific mission you want. At the very least it requires more clicking than the current setup. For example, I know I needed Good Boy yesterday, but I had no idea what stat he was on. Being able to just go to that section and see everything (without needing any additional clicking) worked out well, imo.

Is there any particular need to compress the pages and make it harder to get to the info?

item.title: Re: tabbed view missions
item.content:encoded:
I was just thinking that a tabbed view for missions might be niceâ€¦though I had a bit of a different idea in mind for the organization.

Thinking more about it, all of the sections could use something like this, the default tab for them being blank would condense the page and allow people to find the section they wanted faster. Having a tab to view all the missions in Alphabetical order ( the old way in which in where all done ) would be nice, as well as a either a tab to view them now or tabs like you have them set up now for viewing by main stat check.

However, I don't see much use for the Allies tab. In fact, it actually makes looking for information harder, since you don't have those missions listed under the individual stat types they are. Also, I don't know just how compatible tabbed pages are with older browsers or browsers other than what I use, IE.

Convenience is second to functionality; if a good chunk of users won't be able to use the wiki because the information is put in tabs, then they won't be implemented, simple as that. If we find that the tabbed view is sufficiently compatible, though, I don't see why we shouldn't do this for the missions page and possibly other pages as well.

  • Hide
  • List all
  • Genjutsu
  • Ninjutsu
  • Taijutsu

Click on one of the other tabs to see the missions of this type/rank.

I would still wait for Uzuki's call on this, since it would be a major change. We might want to iron out the idea a bit if tabbed sections like this get the go-ahead, and it would look better if the change happened all at once rather than section by section.

One last edit: The Tabs in my post don't work for me ( currently using IE7 ) due to the way that tabview is coded, so I'm not sure if this can be implemented for some time. The way the thing is coded results in sets of tabs after the first one to not be able to change tabs, it seems; found that out by going to the "Recent posts" area from the main page and seeing that my tabs worked but the ones in your post ( farther down on that page because of how it works ) wouldn't change tabs there.

It's a good idea, but this shows a compatibility problem, though I don't know if that problem is in other browsers as well.

item.title: Re: tabbed view missions
item.content:encoded:
Please tell me if I should reformat the missions page using tabbed view.
Above you can see how the Outskirt missions would look like.

I would also like to include this in some other pages like Jutsu.
